VLIB_hysteresisThresholding

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_hysteresisThresholding (const int16_t *restrict pInMagBlk, uint8_t *edgeMap, uint8_t *restrict scratch, uint16_t blkHeight, uint16_t blkWidth, uint16_t blkPitch, uint8_t loThresh, uint8_t hiThreshold)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_hysteresisThresholding ( const int16_t *restrict  pInMagBlk,
uint8_t *  edgeMap,
uint8_t *restrict  scratch,
uint16_t  blkHeight,
uint16_t  blkWidth,
uint16_t  blkPitch,
uint8_t  loThresh,
uint8_t  hiThreshold 
)

Description
With an edge map containing possible edges, hysteresis thresholding identifies and follows edges. Using both High and Low thresholds,it is able to maintain edge continuity by linking stronger edge segments that are connected to weaker segments.
Parameters:
[in] *pInMagBlk Pointer to array containing magnitude (SQ15.0)
[in,out] *edgeMap Pointer to array Edge map (UQ8.0)
[in] *scratch Pointer to array strong edge list (UQ8.0)
[in] blkHeight Input height (UQ16.0)
[in] blkWidth Input width (UQ16.0)
[in] blkPitch Input pitch (UQ16.0)
[in] loThresh Lower threshold (UQ8.0)
[in] hiThreshold Upper thershold (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • scratch size should be blkWidth*blkHeight*4
  • This function uses assumes that the pInMagBlk and edgeMap buffers have the same pitch.
  • This function uses a 3x3 kernel and references the surrounding 8 pixels in the pInMagBlk for each pixel. Therefore, in order to make sure it accesses valid data, the minimum offset into the valid region of the magnitude buffer that pInMagBlk points to should be the second pixel of the second row. Likewise, the blkWidth should be at least 2 pixels less than the blkPitch, and the blkHeight should be at least 2 rows less than the valid data height of the magnitude buffer.
  • The width should be >= 8
